Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class GeoTessModelUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.geotess.GeoTessModelUtils
  • public class GeoTessModelUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static utilities that extract organized information from a GeoTessModel. There are utilities to retrieve:
    • a map of attribute values at a constant specified depth on a regular latitude-longitude grid.
    • a map of attribute values at top or bottom of a layer on a regular latitude-longitude grid.
    • a map of the depth of the top or bottom of a specified layer on a regular latitude-longitude grid.
    • attribute values interpolated on a vertical slice through a model.
    • attribute values along a radial 'borehole' at a specified position.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  GeoTessModelUtils.Point
      Class that represents a single point on the earth as both a unit vector and as an xy point projected using a Robinson projection.

    • Method Detail

      • getMapValuesDepth

        public static double[][][] getMapValuesDepth​(GeoTessModel model,
                                             double[] latitudes,
                                             double[] longitudes,
                                             int layerId,
                                             double depth,
                                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType,
                                             boolean reciprocal,
                                             int[] attributes)
                                      throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve a map of attribute values at a constant specified depth on a regular latitude-longitude grid.

        If layerId < 0, then interpolation points are not constrained to layer boundaries. An attempt to interpolate a value at a depth which is below the bottom of the bottom layer, or above the top of the top layer, will return Double.NaN.

        If layerId is >= 0 then for every point on the map, if the specified depth is deeper than the depth of the bottom of the specified layer, then attribute values are interpolated at the bottom of the specified layer. Similarly, if the specified depth is shallower than the depth of the top of the specified layer, then attribute values at the top of the specified layer are interpolated.

        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel to be interrogated.
        latitudes - array of latitude values in degrees.
        longitudes - array of longitude values in degrees.
        layerId - layer index
        depth - the depth at which samples should be interpolated, in km.
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Returns:
        double[nlat][nlon][nAttributes]
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getMapValuesLayer

        public static double[][][] getMapValuesLayer​(GeoTessModel model,
                                             double[] latitudes,
                                             double[] longitudes,
                                             int layerId,
                                             double fractionalRadius,
                                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType,
                                             boolean reciprocal,
                                             int[] attributes)
                                      throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve a map of attribute values at top or bottom of a layer on a regular latitude-longitude grid.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel to be interrogated.
        latitudes - array of latitude values in degrees.
        longitudes - array of longitude values in degrees.
        layerId - layer index
        fractionalRadius - the fractional radius within the layer at which samples should be interpolated. Fractional radius <= 0.0 will return values at the bottom of the layer and values >= 1.0 will return values at the top of the layer.
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Returns:
        double[nlat][nlon][nAttributes]
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getValues3D

        public static double[][][][] getValues3D​(GeoTessModel model,
                                         double[] latitudes,
                                         double[] longitudes,
                                         int firstLayer,
                                         int lastLayer,
                                         java.lang.String radialDimension,
                                         double maxRadialSpacing,
                                         gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                                         gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType,
                                         boolean reciprocal,
                                         int[] attributes)
                                  throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve a 3D block of attribute values on a regular lat-lon-radius grid.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel to be interrogated.
        latitudes - array of latitude values in degrees.
        longitudes - array of longitude values in degrees.
        firstLayer - index of deepest layer
        lastLayer - index of shallowest layer
        radialDimension - specifies what values to put in the radialDimension: radius, depth, or layerIndex
        maxRadialSpacing - radial spacing of points in the output will be no larger than this value. The actual radial spacing of points will likely be less so that the number of radii in each layer will be constant.
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Returns:
        double[nlon][nlat][nradii][nAttributes+1] a 4D block of attribute values at the nodes of the 3D lon-lat-radius block. The first element of the attribute array is either the depth, radius, or fractional layerIndex of the node. The remaining elements are the values of the requested attributes.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getMapLayerThickness

        public static double[][] getMapLayerThickness​(GeoTessModel model,
                                              double[] latitudes,
                                              double[] longitudes,
                                              int firstLayer,
                                              int lastLayer,
                                              gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType)
                                       throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve a map of the combined thickness of a set of specified layers, in km. The reported thicknesses will be the sum of the thicknesses of all the layers between the bottom of the first layer and the top of the last layer, inclusive. Results are returned in an nLat x nLon array with longitude dimension varying fastest.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel to be interrogated.
        latitudes - array of latitude values in degrees.
        longitudes - array of longitude values in degrees.
        firstLayer - the index of the deepest layer
        lastLayer - the index of the shallowest layer.
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        Returns:
        map of layer thicknesses in an nLat x nLon array.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getMapLayerBoundary

        public static double[][] getMapLayerBoundary​(GeoTessModel model,
                                             double[] latitudes,
                                             double[] longitudes,
                                             int layerId,
                                             boolean top,
                                             boolean convertToDepth,
                                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType)
                                      throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve a map of the depth or radius of the top or bottom of a specified layer on a regular latitude-longitude grid.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel to be interrogated.
        latitudes - array of latitude values in degrees.
        longitudes - array of longitude values in degrees.
        layerId - layer index
        top - if true, depth of top of layer is reported. Otherwise, depth of bottom of layer.
        convertToDepth - if true, depths are reported, otherwise radii.
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        Returns:
        double[nlat][nlon]
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getSlice

        public static double[][][] getSlice​(GeoTessModel model,
                                    gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon.GreatCircle greatCircle,
                                    int nx,
                                    double maxRadialSpacing,
                                    int firstLayer,
                                    int lastLayer,
                                    gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                                    gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType,
                                    java.lang.String spatialCoordinates,
                                    boolean reciprocal,
                                    int[] attributes)
                             throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve attribute values interpolated on a vertical slice through a model.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel from which slice will be extracted
        greatCircle - the greatCircle that defines the slice
        nx - number of points along great circle path
        maxRadialSpacing - radial spacing of points will be less than or equal to this value (km).
        firstLayer - index of the first layer to include (deepest)
        lastLayer - index of the last layer to include (shallowest)
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        spatialCoordinates - coordinate values to be output along with requested model attributes. A comma delineated String containing a subset of the following strings in any order:
        1. distance -- distance in degrees from x0
        2. depth -- depth in km
        3. radius -- radius in km
        4. x -- observer's 'right' in km
        5. y -- observer's 'up' in km
        6. z -- direction pointing toward the observer, in km
        7. lat -- latitude in degrees
        8. lon -- longitude in degrees
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Returns:
        double[nx][nPoints][spatialCoordinates.length + nAttributes]. The values of spatial coordinates will be output first, followed attribute values. Points will be evenly spaced radially within each layer, with two points on each layer boundary, one associated with values for the top of the layer below the boundary and the other associated with values for the bottom of the layer above the boundary. The first element of each attribute array is either the radius or depth of the corresponding point. Subsequent elements are interpolated values of the attributes.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getBoreholeString

        public static java.lang.String getBoreholeString​(GeoTessPosition pos,
                                                 double maxSpacing,
                                                 int firstLayer,
                                                 int lastLayer,
                                                 boolean convertToDepth,
                                                 boolean reciprocal,
                                                 int[] attributes)
                                          throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve interpolated attribute values along a radial 'borehole' at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - the geographic position where the profile is desired.
        maxSpacing - maximum radial spacing in km of points along the radial profile. Actual radial spacing will generally be somewhat less than the requested value so that there will be an integral number of equally spaced points along the profile.
        firstLayer - index of first layer to be evaluated.
        lastLayer - index of last layer to be evaluated, plus 1.
        convertToDepth - if true, radii are converted to depth
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Returns:
        double[nPoints][nAttributes+1]. Points will be evenly spaced within each layer, with two points on each layer boundary, one associated with values for the top of the layer below the boundary and the other associated with values for the bottom of the layer above the boundary. The first element of each attribute array is either the radius or depth of the corresponding point. Subsequent elements are interpolated values of the attributes.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getBorehole

        public static double[][] getBorehole​(GeoTessPosition pos,
                                     double maxSpacing,
                                     int firstLayer,
                                     int lastLayer,
                                     boolean convertToDepth,
                                     boolean reciprocal,
                                     int[] attributes)
                              throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve interpolated attribute values along a radial 'borehole' at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - GeoTessPosition object where attribute values are to be interpolated
        maxSpacing - maximum radial spacing in km of points along the radial profile. Actual radial spacing will generally be somewhat less than the requested value so that there will be an integral number of equally spaced points along the profile.
        firstLayer - index of deepest layer
        lastLayer - index of shallowest layer. If greater than nLayers-1, the nLayers-1 is used instead.
        convertToDepth - if true radii are converted to depth
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Returns:
        double[nPoints][nAttributes+1]. Points will be evenly spaced within each layer, with two points on each layer boundary, one associated with values for the top of the layer below the boundary and the other associated with values for the bottom of the layer above the boundary. The first element of each attribute array is either the radius or depth of the corresponding point. Subsequent elements are interpolated values of the attributes.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getBorehole

        public static double[][] getBorehole​(GeoTessPosition pos,
                                     int[] pointsPerLayer,
                                     boolean convertToDepth,
                                     boolean reciprocal,
                                     int[] attributes)
                              throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve interpolated attribute values along a radial 'borehole' at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - GeoTessPosition object where attribute values are to be interpolated
        pointsPerLayer - an int[] of length nLayers where each element specifies the number of nodes that are to be generated in that layer.
        convertToDepth - if false, the radii are retured. If true, depths are returned.
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Returns:
        double[nPoints][nAttributes+1]. Points will be evenly spaced within each layer, with two points on each layer boundary, one associated with values for the top of the layer below the boundary and the other associated with values for the bottom of the layer above the boundary. The first element of each attribute array is either the radius or depth of the corresponding point. Subsequent elements are interpolated values of the attributes.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • updatePointsPerLayer

        public static int updatePointsPerLayer​(GeoTessPosition pos,
                                       int firstLayer,
                                       int lastLayer,
                                       double maxSpacing,
                                       int[] pointsPerLayer)
                                throws GeoTessException
        Evaluates maximum number of nodes per layer. On input, pointsPerLayer is an array of length nLayers where each element contains a current estimate of the number of nodes that must be deployed on the corresponding layer so that the node spacing will be no greater than maxSpacing (in km). The values in pointsPerLayer will be evaluated at the specified position and increased if necessary. Only layers between firstLayer and lastLayer, inclusive, will be evaluated.
        Parameters:
        pos - GeoTessPosition object
        firstLayer - first layer to be considered
        lastLayer - last layer to be considered
        maxSpacing - maximum radial node spacing in km
        pointsPerLayer - an array of length model.getNLayers() containing current estimate of the number of nodes per layer such that the node spacing will be no larger than maxSpacing.
        Returns:
        returns the total number of points in all layers, i.e., the sum of the elements of pointsPerLayer.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

        public static double[] getLatitudes​(double first,
                                    double last,
                                    int n,
                                    boolean onCenters)
        Retrieve array of latitude values.
        Parameters:
        first - first latitude (degrees or radians)
        last - last latitude (degrees or radians)
        n - number of latitudes
        onCenters - if false, first value will correspond to x0, last value with x1, and remaining values will be equally spaced. If true, there will n intervals of width dx with a coordinate value in the center of each interval.

      • expandFileName

        public static java.lang.String expandFileName​(java.lang.String fileName,

      • function

        public static GeoTessModel function​(int function,
                                    GeoTessModel m0,
                                    int attribute0,
                                    GeoTessModel m1,
                                    int attribute1,
                                    GeoTessModel pointModel,
                                    java.lang.String attributeName,
                                    java.lang.String attributeUnits,
                                    gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                                    gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType)
                             throws GeoTessException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Construct a new GeoTessModel that has Data values that are a function of the Data values in the two supplied GeoTessModels.
        Parameters:
        function - One of the following functions:
        1. x1 - x0; // simple difference
        2. 1/x1 - 1/x0; // difference of reciprocals
        3. 100 * (x1 - x0) / x0; // % change
        4. 100.*(1/x1 - 1/x0) / (1/x0); // % change of reciprocals
        If function is anything else, new model will be populated with NaN.
        m0 - GeoTessModel zero. Not modified by this function.
        attribute0 - the index of the attribute in model 0 that will be used in the function.
        m1 - GeoTessModel one. Not modified by this function.
        attribute1 - the index of the attribute in model 1 that will be used in the function.
        pointModel - the GeoTessModel that has the geometry and topology that will be reproduced in the new GeoTessModel. This can be the same as m0 or m1. Not modified by this function.
        attributeName - the attribute name that will be assigned in the new model
        attributeUnits - the attribute units that will be assigned in the new model
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        Returns:
        a new model with the geometry and topology of pointModel but with a single attribute value computed from the values in m0 and m1.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException
        java.io.IOException

      • vtk

        public static void vtk​(GeoTessModel model,
                       java.lang.String fileName,
                       int firstLayer,
                       int lastLayer,
                       boolean reciprocal,
                       int[] attributes)
                throws GeoTessException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Generate a VTK file of the geometry, topology and data values at the top of the specified layer. There will be separate file for each layer of the model.
        Parameters:
        model - a reference to the model
        fileName - the name of the file to which output should be written. If the fileName contains '%d' then the layer number is inserted into that position of the fileName. If fileName contains '%s' then the layer name is inserted into that position of the fileName.
        firstLayer - the first (innermost) layer to include
        lastLayer - the last (outermost) layer to include. If value specified is greater than last layer of the model then value is replaced with the index of the last layer in the model.
        reciprocal - if true then plot 1/attribute value instead of attribute value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include. If null, all values are output.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException
        java.io.IOException

      • vtkDepths

        public static void vtkDepths​(GeoTessModel model,
                             java.lang.String fileName,
                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType,
                             int layerId,
                             double[] depths,
                             boolean reciprocal,
                             int[] attributes)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             GeoTessException
        Write the model to a binary VTK file which can be viewed using ParaView (http://www.paraview.org).

        If layerId < 0, then interpolation points are not constrained to layer boundaries.

        If layerId is >= 0 then for every point on the map, if the specified depth is deeper than the depth of the bottom of the specified layer, then attribute values are interpolated at the bottom of the specified layer. Similarly, if the specified depth is shallower than the depth of the top of the specified layer, then attribute values at the top of the specified layer are interpolated.

        Parameters:
        model - a reference to the model
        fileName - the name of the file to which output should be written. Must end with extension 'vtk'.
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        layerId -
        depths -
        reciprocal - if true, 1/value is returned instead of value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include (all if null)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        GeoTessException

      • vtkDepths

        public static void vtkDepths​(GeoTessModel model,
                             java.lang.String outputFile,
                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType interpTypeHoriz,
                             gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType interpTypeRadial,
                             int layerid,
                             double firstDepth,
                             double lastDepth,
                             double depthSpacing,
                             boolean reciprocal,
                             int[] attributes)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             GeoTessException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        GeoTessException

      • vtkTriangleValues

      • vtkSolid

        public static void vtkSolid​(GeoTessModel model,
                            java.lang.String fileName,
                            double maxSpacing,
                            int firstLayerIndex,
                            int lastLayerIndex,
                            gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                            gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType,
                            boolean reciprocal,
                            int[] attributes)
                     throws GeoTessException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Write the model to a binary VTK file which can be viewed using ParaView (http://www.paraview.org).
        Parameters:
        model - a reference to the model
        fileName - the name of the output file. Must have vtk extension.
        maxSpacing - maximum radial spacing in km of points along the radial profile. Actual radial spacing will generally be somewhat less than the requested value so that there will be an integral number of equally spaced points along the profile. 50 km is typically adequate.
        firstLayerIndex - the first (innermost) layer to include
        lastLayerIndex - the last (outermost) layer to include. If value specified is greater than last layer of the model then value is replaced with the index of the last layer in the model.
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        reciprocal - if false, plot attribute value; if true, plot 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException
        java.io.IOException

      • vtkSlice

        public static void vtkSlice​(GeoTessModel model,
                            java.lang.String fileName,
                            gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon.GreatCircle greatCircle,
                            int nx,
                            double maxRadialSpacing,
                            int firstLayer,
                            int lastLayer,
                            gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                            gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType,
                            boolean reciprocal,
                            int[] attributes)
                     throws GeoTessException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Generate a vtk file of attribute values interpolated on a vertical slice through a model.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel from which slice will be extracted
        fileName - the name of the file to receive the vtk output. Must have 'vtk' extension. Also must contain the substring '%d' twice, the first one will be replaced with the tessellation index and the second with the level index.
        greatCircle - the greatCircle that defines the slice to be extracted
        nx - number of points along great circle path
        maxRadialSpacing - radial spacing of points will be less than or equal to this value (km).
        firstLayer - index of the first layer to include (deepest)
        lastLayer - index of the last layer to include (shallowest)
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        reciprocal - if false, return value; if true, return 1./value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException
        java.io.IOException

      • vtkRobinson

        public static void vtkRobinson​(GeoTessModel model,
                               java.io.File outputFile,
                               double centerLonDegrees,
                               double depth,
                               int layer,
                               boolean radiusOutOfRangeAllowed,
                               gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialInterpType,
                               boolean reciprocal,
                               int[] attributes)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Generate a contour map of some data values on a Robinson projection of the Earth.

        Also generates another file that contains the outlines of the continents plotted on the same map projection. The file is located in the same directory as the outputFile, with the name 'map_coastlines_centerLon_%d.vtk' where %d is replaced with the longitude of the center of the map rounded to the nearest degree.

        Parameters:
        model - the model containing the grid and data to be plotted.
        outputFile - the name of the file to which to write the output. Must end with extension 'vtk'.
        centerLonDegrees - the longitude of the center of the map in degrees.
        depth - the depth in the Earth where the data is to be interpolated.
        layer - the index of the layer in which depth resides.
        radiusOutOfRangeAllowed - if true and depth is above the top of layer or below bottom of layer then the values at the top or bottom of layer are plotted. If false and depth is above the top of layer or below bottom of layer then NaN is plotted.
        radialInterpType - InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        reciprocal - if true, then the reciprocal values are plotted, otherwise unmodified model values are plotted.
        attributes - array of attribute indeces to plot (if null, all are plotted).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • vtkRobinson

        public static void vtkRobinson​(GeoTessModel model,
                               java.io.File outputFile,
                               double centerLonDegrees,
                               double depth,
                               int layer,
                               int level,
                               boolean radiusOutOfRangeAllowed,
                               gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialInterpType,
                               boolean reciprocal,
                               int[] attributes)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Generate a contour map of some data values on a Robinson projection of the Earth.

        Also generates another file that contains the outlines of the continents plotted on the same map projection. The file is located in the same directory as the outputFile, with the name 'map_coastlines_centerLon_%d.vtk' where %d is replaced with the longitude of the center of the map rounded to the nearest degree.

        Parameters:
        model - the model containing the grid and data to be plotted.
        outputFile - the name of the file to which to write the output. Must end with extension 'vtk'.
        centerLonDegrees - the longitude of the center of the map in degrees.
        depth - the depth in the Earth where the data is to be interpolated.
        layer - the index of the layer in which depth resides.
        level - the index of the level relative to the levels of tessellation that supports the specified layer. If out-of-range, defaults to last layer in the tessellation that supports the specified layer.
        radiusOutOfRangeAllowed - if true and depth is above the top of layer or below bottom of layer then the values at the top or bottom of layer are plotted. If false and depth is above the top of layer or below bottom of layer then NaN is plotted.
        radialInterpType - InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        reciprocal - if true, then the reciprocal values are plotted, otherwise unmodified model values are plotted.
        attributes - array of attribute indeces to plot (if null, all are plotted).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                    double fracRadius,
                                                    int attributeIndex,
                                                    boolean reciprocal,
                                                    int layerID,
                                                    int numOfPixelsHorizontal,
                                                    java.awt.Color[] colors)
                                             throws GeoTessException
        Creates an image of the model with minimum parameters. Uses default lat/lon ([-90,90] and [-180,180]) and a Color[] for which values in the model will be divided up into ranges and interpolated between those Colors.
        Parameters:
        model - - GeoTessModel, whose values will be used to compute the colors of pixels in the resulting image.
        fracRadius - - the fractional radius within the layer at which samples should be interpolated. Fractional radius <= 0.0 will return values at the bottom of the layer and values >= 1.0 will return values at the top of the layer.
        attributeIndex - - index of GeoTessModel attribute at which to retrieve data values from the model.
        reciprocal - - Passed to the call to getMapValuesLayer() to read the model data. From that function: "if false, return value; if true, return 1./value".
        layerID - - layerID to access
        numOfPixelsHorizontal - - width of image in pixels. The height of the image will be calculated using the aspect ratio between the latitude range and longitude range. 720 is a reasonable value for this parameter, which will create a 360x720 pixel BufferedImage.
        colors - - Color[] representing a color gradient on which to map the values of the model. Two common ways to make one: 1.) Construct one manually with Color constructors. For example, "Color[] colors = new Color[] {Color.RED, Color.WHITE, Color.BLUE};" There are other ways to construct a Java.awt.Color object, see the API for more details. 2.) Use the gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap package from project Utils, which has an enum for some Color arrays. For example, "Color[] colors = SimpleColorMap.ColorGradient.RED_WHITE_BLUE.colors;"
        Returns:
        - BufferedImage rendering of the values in the model on a color gradient specified by the input color array.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - - possibly from reading GeoTessModel

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                    double minLat,
                                                    double maxLat,
                                                    double minLon,
                                                    double maxLon,
                                                    double fracRadius,
                                                    int attributeIndex,
                                                    boolean reciprocal,
                                                    int layerID,
                                                    int numOfPixelsHorizontal,
                                                    java.awt.Color[] colors)
                                             throws GeoTessException
        Creates an image while specifying bounds for latitude and longitude. The minimum and maximum values in the model will be found directly (since they're not specified) and used to compute Colors for each value.
        Parameters:
        model - - GeoTessModel, whose values will be used to compute the colors of pixels in the resulting image.
        minLat - - minimum latitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLat - - maximum latutude at which to draw the model in degrees
        minLon - - minimum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLon - - maximum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        fracRadius - - the fractional radius within the layer at which samples should be interpolated. Fractional radius <= 0.0 will return values at the bottom of the layer and values >= 1.0 will return values at the top of the layer.
        attributeIndex - - index of GeoTessModel attribute at which to retrieve data values from the model.
        reciprocal - - Passed to the call to getMapValuesLayer() to read the model data. From that function: "if false, return value; if true, return 1./value".
        layerID - - layerID to access
        numOfPixelsHorizontal - - width of image in pixels. The height of the image will be calculated using the aspect ratio between the latitude range and longitude range. 720 is a reasonable value for this parameter, which will create a 360x720 pixel BufferedImage.
        colors - - Color[] representing a color gradient on which to map the values of the model. Two common ways to make one: 1.) Construct one manually with Color constructors. For example, "Color[] colors = new Color[] {Color.RED, Color.WHITE, Color.BLUE};" There are other ways to construct a Java.awt.Color object, see the API for more details. 2.) Use the gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap package from project Utils, which has an enum for some Color arrays. For example, "Color[] colors = SimpleColorMap.ColorGradient.RED_WHITE_BLUE.colors;"
        Returns:
        BufferedImage rendering of the values in the model on a color gradient specified by the input color array.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - - possibly from reading a GeoTessModel

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                    double minLat,
                                                    double maxLat,
                                                    double minLon,
                                                    double maxLon,
                                                    double fracRadius,
                                                    int attributeIndex,
                                                    boolean reciprocal,
                                                    int layerID,
                                                    int numOfPixelsHorizontal,
                                                    java.awt.Color[] colors,
                                                    double[] colorValues)
                                             throws GeoTessException
        Makes an image with custom defined color ranges given by a Color[] and matching double[]. This allows the caller to define color ranges/spacings that are of nonuniform size by specifying exactly which data values map to which colors (and thus implicitly the ranges of values for which color values will be interpolated). For example, specifying colors = {Color.RED, Color.WHITE, Color.BLUE} and values = [5, 10, 15] will set values <= 5 to RED, values that == 10 to WHITE, and values >= 15 to BLUE. Values in (5,10) will be interpolated linearly between RED and WHITE, and in (10,15) will be interpolated linearly between WHITE and BLUE.
        Parameters:
        model - - GeoTessModel, whose values will be used to compute the colors of pixels in the resulting image.
        minLat - - minimum latitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLat - - maximum latutude at which to draw the model in degrees
        minLon - - minimum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLon - - maximum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        fracRadius - - the fractional radius within the layer at which samples should be interpolated. Fractional radius <= 0.0 will return values at the bottom of the layer and values >= 1.0 will return values at the top of the layer.
        attributeIndex - - index of GeoTessModel attribute at which to retrieve data values from the model.
        reciprocal - - Passed to the call to getMapValuesLayer() to read the model data. From that function: "if false, return value; if true, return 1./value".
        layerID - - layerID to access
        numOfPixelsHorizontal - - width of image in pixels. The height of the image will be calculated using the aspect ratio between the latitude range and longitude range. 720 is a reasonable value for this parameter, which will create a 360x720 pixel BufferedImage.
        colors - - Color[] representing a color gradient on which to map the values of the model. Two common ways to make one: 1.) Construct one manually with Color constructors. For example, "Color[] colors = new Color[] {Color.RED, Color.WHITE, Color.BLUE};" There are other ways to construct a Java.awt.Color object, see the API for more details. 2.) Use the gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap package from project Utils, which has an enum for some Color arrays. For example, "Color[] colors = SimpleColorMap.ColorGradient.RED_WHITE_BLUE.colors;"
        colorValues - - defines the locations along the value line to which the colors will map to. In other words, specifying this parameter changes the ranges of values that get mapped to colors.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage rendering of the values in the model on a color gradient specified by the input color array.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - - possibly from reading a GeoTessModel

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                    double fracRadius,
                                                    double minValue,
                                                    double maxValue,
                                                    int attributeIndex,
                                                    boolean reciprocal,
                                                    int layerID,
                                                    int numOfPixelsHorizontal,
                                                    java.awt.Color[] colors)
                                             throws GeoTessException
        Makes an image with defined color ranges given by a Color[]. Uses the default lat/lon bounds of lat[-90, 90] and lon[-180,180]. This method also allows the color to specify the min and max values of the data model for which to interpolate colors - data values outside of [minValue, maxValue] will be set to the min and max colors, respectively (colors[0] and colors[colors.length-1]).
        Parameters:
        model - - GeoTessModel, whose values will be used to compute the colors of pixels in the resulting image.
        fracRadius - - the fractional radius within the layer at which samples should be interpolated. Fractional radius <= 0.0 will return values at the bottom of the layer and values >= 1.0 will return values at the top of the layer.
        minValue - - minimum value of model to consider. Any data value in the model less than minValue will be given the color colors[0].
        maxValue - - maximum value of model to consider. Any data value in the model greater than maxValue will be given the color colors[colors.length-1].
        attributeIndex - - index of GeoTessModel attribute at which to retrieve data values from the model.
        reciprocal - - Passed to the call to getMapValuesLayer() to read the model data. From that function: "if false, return value; if true, return 1./value".
        layerID - - layerID to access
        numOfPixelsHorizontal - - width of image in pixels. The height of the image will be calculated using the aspect ratio between the latitude range and longitude range. 720 is a reasonable value for this parameter, which will create a 360x720 pixel BufferedImage.
        colors - - Color[] representing a color gradient on which to map the values of the model. Two common ways to make one: 1.) Construct one manually with Color constructors. For example, "Color[] colors = new Color[] {Color.RED, Color.WHITE, Color.BLUE};" There are other ways to construct a Java.awt.Color object, see the API for more details. 2.) Use the gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap package from project Utils, which has an enum for some Color arrays. For example, "Color[] colors = SimpleColorMap.ColorGradient.RED_WHITE_BLUE.colors;"
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - - possibly from reading a GeoTessModel

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                    double minLat,
                                                    double maxLat,
                                                    double minLon,
                                                    double maxLon,
                                                    double fracRadius,
                                                    double minValue,
                                                    double maxValue,
                                                    int attributeIndex,
                                                    boolean reciprocal,
                                                    int layerID,
                                                    int numOfPixelsHorizontal,
                                                    java.awt.Color[] colors)
                                             throws GeoTessException
        Makes an image with specified lat/lon ranges, min and max values of the model to consider for color interpolation, and a Color[] defining the colors to use.
        Parameters:
        model - - GeoTessModel, whose values will be used to compute the colors of pixels in the resulting image.
        minLat - - minimum latitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLat - - maximum latutude at which to draw the model in degrees
        minLon - - minimum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLon - - maximum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        fracRadius - - the fractional radius within the layer at which samples should be interpolated. Fractional radius <= 0.0 will return values at the bottom of the layer and values >= 1.0 will return values at the top of the layer
        minValue - - minimum value of model to consider. Any data value in the model less than minValue will be given the color colors[0].
        maxValue - - maximum value of model to consider. Any data value in the model greater than maxValue will be given the color colors[colors.length-1].
        attributeIndex - - index of GeoTessModel attribute at which to retrieve data values from the model.
        reciprocal - - Passed to the call to getMapValuesLayer() to read the model data. From that function: "if false, return value; if true, return 1./value".
        layerID - - layerID to access
        numOfPixelsHorizontal - - width of image in pixels. The height of the image will be calculated using the aspect ratio between the latitude range and longitude range. 720 is a reasonable value for this parameter, which will create a 360x720 pixel BufferedImage.
        colors - - Color[] representing a color gradient on which to map the values of the model. Two common ways to make one: 1.) Construct one manually with Color constructors. For example, "Color[] colors = new Color[] {Color.RED, Color.WHITE, Color.BLUE};" There are other ways to construct a Java.awt.Color object, see the API for more details. 2.) Use the gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap package from project Utils, which has an enum for some Color arrays. For example, "Color[] colors = SimpleColorMap.ColorGradient.RED_WHITE_BLUE.colors;"
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - - possibly from reading a GeoTessModel

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                    double minLat,
                                                    double maxLat,
                                                    double minLon,
                                                    double maxLon,
                                                    double fracRadius,
                                                    int attributeIndex,
                                                    boolean reciprocal,
                                                    int layerID,
                                                    int numOfPixelsHorizontal,
                                                    gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap.ColorMap cm)
                                             throws GeoTessException
        Creates a BufferedImage representation of the values of a GeoTessModel.
        Parameters:
        model - - GeoTessModel, whose values will be used to compute the colors of pixels in the resulting image.
        minLat - - minimum latitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLat - - maximum latutude at which to draw the model in degrees
        minLon - - minimum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        maxLon - - maximum longitude at which to draw the model in degrees
        fracRadius - - the fractional radius within the layer at which samples should be interpolated. Fractional radius <= 0.0 will return values at the bottom of the layer and values >= 1.0 will return values at the top of the layer.
        attributeIndex - - index of GeoTessModel attribute at which to retrieve data values from the model.
        reciprocal - - Passed to the call to getMapValuesLayer() to read the model data. From that function: "if false, return value; if true, return 1./value".
        layerID - - layerID to access
        numOfPixelsHorizontal - - width of image in pixels. The height of the image will be calculated using the aspect ratio between the latitude range and longitude range. 720 is a reasonable value for this parameter, which will create a 360x720 pixel BufferedImage.
        cm - - ColorMap to use for interpolation. If the min and max values of the ColorMap are NaN, the minimum and maximum values of the model will be found and used to make a new ColorMap. See the gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap package in the Utils project for more info.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage rendering of the values in the model on a color gradient specified by the input color array.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - - possibly from reading a GeoTessModel

      • vtkIntegral

        public static void vtkIntegral​(GeoTessModel model,
                               java.lang.String fileName,
                               int firstLayer,
                               int lastLayer,
                               boolean reciprocal,
                               int[] attributes)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               GeoTessException
        Generate a VTK file of the
        Parameters:
        model - a reference to the model
        fileName - the name of the file to which output should be written. If the fileName contains '%d' then the layer number is inserted into that position of the fileName. If fileName contains '%s' then the layer name is inserted into that position of the fileName.
        firstLayer - the first (innermost) layer to include
        lastLayer - the last (outermost) layer to include. If value specified is greater than last layer of the model then value is replaced with the index of the last layer in the model.
        reciprocal - if true then plot 1/attribute value instead of attribute value.
        attributes - indexes of the attributes to include. If null, all values are output.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException
        java.io.IOException
